We did notice a large rat trap in the yard amongst the beer cans and fag ends, totally unnecessary no self respecting rat would stay in this hotel. Ok it was cheap but even if it was free it would still be poor value for money. Avoid it like the plague, which is probably what you'll leave London with if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Mould, glorious mould!!”
Reviews.Author: nyrdan
Reviews.Content: WHAT THE? We were placed on the top floor in a room that appears to have been bigger than most. The toilet/shower was absolutely disgraceful - full of mould and a filthy stench coming from the drain. The actual shower wasnt big enough to bathe a baby in. The weather was atrocious - which I only mention because it was reflected in our room. The bed and all of the blankets/sheets were soaking wet because the roof was leaking all over it. We ended up having to move the bed (which was actually a mattress sitting on wooden boxes) into another position in the room because of the rain. Renovations were being completed in the room next door to us, although these only ever occurred from 11.00 pm until the early hours of the morning. The builders were obviously nocturnal. We stayed here for 4 nights and at the end of it, we were both really sick. We went to check out to find the doorman asleep in a sleeping bag on the floor of reception. We gratetfully threw the keys in his general direction and walked out. I think I would have much rather stayed on a bench in the local park, which I will probably be doing should we again find ourselves in the same position. After having stayed at a large number of hostels, this hotel is only good for knocking down. Do yourself a favour and don't even consider it.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holla118118
Reviews.Content: My Sister And I Just Got Back From A 1 Night Stay At The Park Hotel, 1 Night Was All We Needed, It Was Awfull, We Arrived Around 2pm In the Afternoon, the phrase "dont judge a book by is cover" is SO true in this case. he road and outside of he hotel looks amazing very high class but inside it looked like a council flat. we waited around 30 mins at reseption because no one was there, another person infornt of us has been waiting even longer, When somone finally arrived he spoke very bad enlish and was very hard to understand. We Finally got our room key and paid by cash but was shocked to discover if you pay via cash you have to pay a £2 service charge, what service? We Droped Out Bags off and headed into london, we were seeing a concert so we were not planning on spending any real time in the hotel, just to sleep really. We arrived back at he hotem around midnight, As before there was no one in reception, after around 20 mins i noticed a man outside smoking i asked if he worked there and he said "yeah, why" i said well we want the keys to our room, he was very rude and seemed annoyed he had to stop smoking and do what he is paid to do. The Room we were in #9 was like a prison, it was small, smelly and very unclean, We booked a room with 2 double beds, we only got 1 double and 1 single, here was only 2 of us and it costed us £60 for 1 night. The beds in the room were hard and smelly, it was the worst nights sleep i have ever had. he bathroom made me sick, it was more like a cupboard, the toilet was brown with durt, the shower had no holder so you had to hold it to take a shower, he floor was uneven and when you ook a shower the whole tfloor was in a centermeter of water. The breakfast was no even worth looking at, the cerial was in wha can only be described as a drinks despencer, god knows how long it had been there, All in all it was the WORST hotel i have ever stayed in, i was noisy, smelly and unclean, how i can call itself a hotel is beyond me.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY at PARK HOTEL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravellingJapan
Reviews.Content: It was the WORST hotel I've ever stayed!!! I booked for 3 nights, but it was SOOOOO terrible that i ran away from the hotel after the first night. I asked them to pay me back for the other 2 nights, but of course they said NO! My room was on the 4th floor and i had a heavy suitcase so i asked for their help, but they said NO! They were very very rude in many ways!! The room was extremely filthy!!! The coffee cup wasn't cleaned!!! Tiny room, noise from other rooms and the street and tiniest bathroom I've ever seen...! I'm a small Japanese girl, but it was so hard to take shower in the tiny bathroom and of course the entire bathroom got soaked!! I knew I wasn't going to get the money back, but I didn't wanna ruin my wonderful vacation in London, so I went to look for another hotel on the first night. I wasted 80 pounds(for 2 nights), but I'm glad I changed the hotels!! If you wanna have a great experience in London, pay a little more to stay somewhere else! I paid 50 pounds(only 10 pounds more than Park hotel), and I got a really nice hotel. I hope my review will help somebody who wants to enjoy their trip!!

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For.”
Reviews.Author: ghjkl
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my friend for two nights in January. I didn’t expect it to be brilliant and to be honest I got what I paid for. From the other comments I think I got off lightly. We arrived late on the Friday night to not a very welcoming reception. He seemed to only have money on the brain and that was his first priority. When we paid he seemed to lighten up and showed us to our room, I do not remember the number now but it was on the reception floor at the end of the hall. The room was very very small two single beds a table with a kettle and cups which we did not use there was just enough room for our bags to fit behind the door and that was it. I noticed when I entered the room that the curtains were closed and my first thought was they must be hiding the spectacular view and I was not far wrong, a lovely brick wall greeted us so the room was just as dark with the curtains opened. Our room was not cleaned throughout our stay but that did not bother me as the sheets seemed to be clean and fresh upon our arrival. The bathroom was small and cramped which was to be expected. The room was so small the little radiator which occupied one wall seemed to over power us with heat which was not such a bad thing. We were able to leave our bags in the hotel after check out on the last day for an extra fee of 5 pounds which I thought would be more as the man at reception seemed like he would sell his own sister for a few bucks We had a brilliant time over all in London and I can’t wait to go back again although I will not be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price, but be prepared!”
Reviews.Author: Matilda82
Reviews.Content: I didn't look at Trip Advisor before I went on this short break (which is unusual for me!), and I'm glad I didn't! I feel, based on my experience, that these reviews are a little harsh, unless we were just lucky! My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for four nights in January 2008, and seeing as the whole stay only cost £140 (£17.50 pppn) I was expecting the pits! But we decided to book anyway due to the great location, and the notion that we'd hardly be spending any time there! Throughout our stay, day and night, the men on reception were polite enough. Yes the stairs are narrow, the room was very small and the bathroom was a tiny prefabricated “Wet-Room” unit, not unlike those found in caravans; but everything worked, we always had hot water and most of all it was clean. Some people stay away in caravans for weeks on end and don’t complain that their toilet set gets wet when they have a shower! The breakfast was basic, but there was plenty of it: Orange Juice, Cereals, Toast & Jam, and Tea & Coffee. But beware it finishes bang on time, and if you miss it it’s tough luck I’m afraid! We generally left the hotel around eight or nine in the morning and got back around midnight each night, so as expected we weren’t there long! I’m glad we stayed there but unfortunately we didn’t get any pictures to share with you. As the title for this review states be prepared for the worst and complain if anything’s wrong! (Although I can’t comment on whether it would’ve been effective to complain, because we didn’t have to.) If you have booked it already, don’t let these reviews put you off, just look forward to whatever it is you’re going to London for!!

Reviews.Title: “An expensive dirty cramped cupboard in London costing the earth”
Reviews.Author: beth1936
Reviews.Content: We got transferred to this hotel after making a booking at the 101 Belgrave Road London which apparently had some electrical problems so was unable to accommodate us and this was an associate Hotel. The room was very small the fixtures were of very a poor quality the chest of drawers were all broken,mugs were chipped wash hand basin was cracked with no stopper and T/V did not work, This is the worst experience I have ever had staying at a Bed & Breakfast anywhere. High volume of conversation in reception area going on untill the early hours of the morning resulting in very little sleep allthough the bed was comfortable. In all this was very expensive at £65.00 for a single nights stay

Reviews.Title: “Never EVER again there”
Reviews.Author: ThyPy
Reviews.Content: Travelled with my family to stay a weekend in London, booked through Central IR. Nice street (Belgrave rd), polite staff. Entering my room started the terrible experience, it looked like never been cleaned for ages! ear-swab, a lost male stocking, trash paper and dust under the beds, bathroom with dark lime layer over the bath floor.... 3 extra pounds to pay with credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!!! Do not go to this hotel! Night receptionist hasn't even got manners!!”
Reviews.Author: vanpru
Reviews.Content: After arriving to London in a late flight, we arrived at the hotel at 11.30pm. There was nobody there at reception, we had to wait for at least 10 minutes before someone arrived. When the receptionist finally arrived we were given a room at the basement(a family room for 5 ppl - don't know why considering that we were only 2!). Once we were finally in bed we realised that everytime the receptionist moved, the floor creeked really really bad. I went up to the reception to tell the man to move us. He said that all the room were full (there was a sign on the door stating that there where rooms available!) and that i could change rooms in the morning. We had a terrible night! It took over an hour for us to fall asleep. We were wokened by footsteps again at 6.30 am. The following morning we went up to the reception and told the man to change the rooms for us as he had said the night before. He then told us that we had to pay £5 for the laundry!! We were furious! There was no way i was gonna pay an extra £5! ( and now reading the other reviews of the rooms on the higher floors don't regret it!) We didn't even have breakfast there - the breakfast room is horrible, in the same reception room, above my room. They only have a kettle, micro and few jars of cereals! Beware this hotel is horrible! Night receptionist has no consideration what so ever and is extremly rude!! They just want your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wont be staying here again”
Reviews.Author: Suddabmp01
Reviews.Content: We arrived, and had to wait until a receptionist returned about 10 minutes later. We weren't expecting The Ritz, but we didn't expect what we got. The room was small with a double bed, a tv, and 2 mirrors. That was all that was in there as well as the bathroom. There was no wardrobe, drawers, bedside table, or anything like that. The bathroom was so small, you could shower, use the toilet, shave, and brush your teeth all at once, no that we did. The first thing we noticed were the stains on the bed cover. The sheets underneath were clean, but the top cover was disgusting. The ceiling was just plaster board, there were cracks in the walls and stains on them too. The location was brilliant, and if you are just staying for one night, its is not too bad once you get over the initial reaction of disgust. The towels were clean, and its about a 10 minute walk to the tube station at Pimlico. However, i would not recommend the hotel to any friends

Reviews.Title: “Urgh”
Reviews.Author: KF1980
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gross. My room absolutely stank of mould and damp, there was a thick layer of dust on the carpet behind the door, and the toilet had definitely not been cleaned in weeks. The en-suite bathroom was like a portaloo (and it smelled like it) that had been dumped in the worlds smallest bedroom. It was five stories with no lift. The TV reception was abysmal, I couldn't bear to have it on it was so crackly. The mattress was so worn there was a spring poking through. I came in one day to find a man using the shared toilet with the door wide open. This is not a place for anyone with an ounce of decency to stay, please please please stay somewhere else. Go for a hotel with a name you recognise in this area - Days Inn or Holiday Inn, at least you know what to expect there.

Reviews.Title: “disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: fireeyes
Reviews.Content: This was a disgusting hotel. I wouldn't recommend this to a bum. The floors were nasty with hair all over it. Mold in the bathroom, bugs on the floor. They only give you towel and sometimes we had to ask for that and then they were the size of a dish cloth. There was an exposed socket we asked them to cover or fix and they didn't. We had to wait several times for hotel staff to show up to let us in our room - we waiting anywhere from 30-45 minutes. The shower was smaller than what you would find in a travel trailer. There is no elevator and my husband has a bad back - we asked for a first floor room and they said no. The small nightstand had bugs and someone elses hair in the drawers with their receipts. There were baby carriages in the hallway so you couldn't even get through unless you moved them out of the hallway. This is not a one star rating which is supposed to be comparable to Super 8 ect. NOT EVEN CLOSE!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Ever Ever Ever Stay At This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bleh1988
Reviews.Content: me and my partner stayed in this hellhole for 3 nights. we had booked to stay in another hotel The Chester Hotel in Longmoore Street but when we arrived were told that the hotel was booked up so we would have to go to another hotel. we arrived at The Park and were brought down a set of stairs. At the bottom of the stairs we were left to wait while the 2 men left through the firedoor. they came back about 10minutes later and we were told to follow them to our room. now london have these houses that have a little room thats not attached to the main house but thats actually built directly under the pavement. this was our room. there was a double bed, a lamp on the floor and a sink in the corner. the room was cold, damp and you could hear the people on the pavement above all day and night. we were told on the first night that this room was only temp until another guest left the next morning. the next day we said to the manager about the new room and he informed us that the room we were staying in was the room we would have until we left. we had to pay on the first night also which i dont think was right. we asked about shower facilities and were told that it would be impossibe to have a shower and if we really wanted a shower we could go to a different hotel. whenever we started to complain the manager would pretend he could not speak english and speak hindu. t the park hotel is nothing but a disaster and i would strongly reccommend that you find somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I will never be the same again...”
Reviews.Author: Glenn_Katie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Hotel in December of 2005. Even after this time I still can't get over how bad it was. My wife and I stayed with another couple who we were travelling with in the very bottom room of the place (it had two double beds). Our first impression was VERY LOW BUDGET, but we had accepted it would probably be cheap and nasty when we booked - and we had decided the location was worth the risk. I can still remember the room and its problems even now. I get a chill down my spine thinking of it. Here's a list of what was wrong: 1) My wife pulled back the bedsheets and found a used band-aid. So much for clean sheets! We slept in sleeping bags instead on top of the bed. The beds were also awful. I'm sure they must have been on Noah's Ark. 2) Our room was right below the entrance. Every time (lasting until 2am in the morning) when someone entered the hotel above us, we were all woken by the creaking floor above. 3) The shower/toilet/basin made it possible to simultaneously shower, do a #2 and clean your teeth at the same time. Not that we did, but it was the first (and only) such bathroom where this would be theroretically possible that we have seen. 4) On the subject of the bathroom - a furry mould grew in it, and water leaked out of it into the room at the rate that the Thames River discharges into the sea. 5) The TV was precariously placed on a wardrobe. I refused to sleep under it because I felt that either the TV would fall down, or the wardrobe would collapse - either case leading to a visit to the Royal London Hospital if it happened. I was frankly amazed that the TV was in colour given its age. 6) Some rude staff. One of the staff members would abuse his cleaning staff in front of guests for being 2 minutes late. Very unprofessional, and also uncomfortable. 7) Stairs down to our room were so narrow I had to go down sideways. I am not overweight. The width of the stairwell would have been approximately 40-50cm. So far... 7 points against. The only plus is the location. We did stick it out for our full 5 nights, though, as we didn't have the money to book a better place. I'm not quite sure what ill effects I suffer to this day after staying there - but I'm sure there must be something. No one could stay in a place like that and not pick up some disease/fungus. Oddly enough one staff number took a liking to us. He even referred to us "Ah my friends from number 1" (our room number was 1). I suspect that may have been because we set a record for the length stayed there, and he thought we might give the place a glowing review. He is sadly mistaken.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Hotel should be gutted”
Reviews.Author: lnjohnston
Reviews.Content: After having reservation troubles due to lastminutelondon.com, I had to get the booth at Victoria Station to book a room for me. My plane to the US was early the next day. This is the worst hotel I've ever stayed in--anywhere. They could not give me a receipt, I reminded them twice I wanted a 5 am wakeup call, the room and bath were filthy. The next morning, no wakeup call, no hot water. Luckily I always set an alarm as well. They were asleep when I wanted to check out, and when I woke the desk man, he was grumbling that he had slept through 2 more wakeup calls. It should be closed and gutted. Spending the night at Gatwick would have been preferable, but no trains after midnight. Worst 55 pounds ever spent. I wish I'd been pick-pocketed on the street instead. Your site lists it as far more money! NO NO a Thousand times NO. Stay at Gatwick if you can get there, at least it's cleaner, and has hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Troubles with the Park Hotel in Belgravia”
Reviews.Author: babs2190
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel in a row of renovated townhouses. The renovations created tiny little rooms with very little air in them. The beds were mattresses set on what seemed to be boxes. The bathroom was a prefabricated unit that was inserted into a small room and had barely enough room to stand in. When you took a shower, the toilet and the floor were soaked with water. The room was airless, but it was fairly quiet, and it was clean. The shower curtain was filthy but the staff did change it two days after they were asked. Not a place we would return to. Even though the price was low, it still wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Still Nasty After All These Years”
Reviews.Author: Mellon
Reviews.Content: It is a shame that the bathroom's hygiene did not measure up to the standard of hygiene that the rest of the hotel so sadly lacked. My wife and I stayed at the Park Hotel for one night in 2003. We often reminisce about our experience there, and I logged on to Trip Advisor recently to see if anything had changed. Surprisingly, the hotel seems just as awful as it was in 2003. I am frankly shocked that the health authorities have not shut this "hotel" down. As was the case with so many other individuals who have reviewed the Park, we stayed there due to its proximity to Victoria Station. We were flying back to the States the next day and just needed a place that was convenient for one night. We stopped into a British Tourist Information office near Victoria Station, and the employee there told us that we'd "really like the Park". We were surprised at having to pay the hotel prior to our stay, but figured that the room would at least be passable. As so many other reviewers have stated, this is the worst, most disgusting, unhygienic hotel that I have ever seen. At first, it just seems small (especially the "bathrooms"), a little smelly, and laughable, but it rapidly goes downhill after a few minutes. Neither my wife nor I were initially willing to admit to the other that the place was awful - especially after we had paid for the night. It was only later that we discovered that each of us was ready to leave the moment we got into the room. In fact, my wife deliberately stayed up the whole night, fearing that sleeping on the bed would give her some sort of disease. I awoke after a fitful sleep to the overpowering stench of disinfectant in the combination sink/toilet/shower that measured perhaps 2-1/2 feet squared. I'm convinced that the Park stays open due to some sort of questionable arrangement with various regulatory agencies and/or the British Tourist Authority. It certainly can not get its customers through repeat business. Unlike some of the other reviewers, I actually recommend staying at the Park for one night. It will make you appreciate literally anywhere else in the world you stay. It will also give you a benchmark for atrocity in service, cleanliness, truth in advertising, and anything that can possibly go wrong in the hospitality field.

Reviews.Title: “Booked a Double Room, got a Bunk Bed”
Reviews.Author: Michiel096
Reviews.Content: I booked a Double Twin Room, more than 4 months in advance. When we got there, we got a small attic room (ca 2 by 2.5 metres) with a bunk bed, that smelled unpleasantly even after cleaning. The condition of the room was poor, the TV was broken (unless you wanted to hold you finger on the canal switch all the time). In spite of my complaints, they would not give me another room, claiming the hotel was full. Afterwards they told Hotels.com that there were several other rooms available but that I had refused them. A final word about safety: the fire exit was locked. There was a sign advising to smash the door's window. This window however was of armoured glass. The hotel staff denied that the fire exit was locked - of course.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: sandersandrew
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean, vibrant, hygenic and pleasant are words often used to describe hotels. Unfortunately none apply to the Park Hotel. You know when you read sites like trip advisor and you assume that "well, only people who really liked or really hated a hotel are going to post anything" so you can probably take their reviews with a pinch of salt? Yeah? Not one review I have read on this site even comes close to describing the horror of this place. We booked it to have a hotel near to victoria station, therefore handy for the underground. It was, to be fair, quite close to victoria station, although at least 15 hotels are closer. We found our room, un-cleaned at 3pm, to be about as big as most standard box rooms in student flats. The TV was hanging onto the wall for dear life by a bracket that doubled as a wardrobe. There was a gap of about 2 inches between the bed and the walls. The bathroom was essentially a large plastic sink, walled into the corner of an already small room with the pleasant odour of mildew eminating from within. The hot water outlet had no tap, so just poured out onto the floor. The shower took around 15 minutes to warm up. Unfortunately to leave the shower running for 15 minutes meant that the badly fitted shower curtain blocked the plug hole, flooding the bathroom and dripping on the unfortunate souls below you. If you wanted to play a practical joke on someone, you might book them a week in the park. There must be somewhere in the region of 10,000 hotels in London and I wouldn't bet that each of them is better than the Park. Do not, under any circumstances, stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy, horrible, small the worst adjectives to describe a place that should be”
Reviews.Author: mariloli
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have ever been in my life, filthy, disgusting, horrible, the receptionman rude, breakfast ... no comment. DON'T GO if you respect yopurselves.Lola. Spain

Reviews.Title: “The most useless "hotel" I've ever seen!”
Reviews.Author: Spiketheskinnydog
Reviews.Content: The service I received was abysmal. The reception manager at the hotel claimed that he had not received notice of my booking - dispite having sent me an email conforming it - blaming a "computer fault". This resulted in me having to hunt around central London for over an hour, trying to secure an alternative hotel. As I had to attend an extremely important meeting the next morning I was tired, hot and entirely fed up that evening. The service was the worst I have experienced anywhere on Earth - and that is no exageration. Anybody wishing to stay in London should instead one of the hundreds of others, not this sorry place.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Rotten Stinky Smelly Hole!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DANIELLAM722
Reviews.Content: do not stay in this hotel as it is the worst i have ever seen in my life it is filthy rotten stinking i wouldnt even let my dog stay in it the beds where stained the toilet you could not see any white at the bottom of it. It is a pokey hole with no room staff werent helpful they where checky sent us to a room downstairs in the basement with a baby and didnt even help with our luggage and babys pram. View was a brick wall. We requested a cot as it said we could on the website but when we got there there was no cot and when i asked they said we dont have cots we decided to leave after half an hour at the most and they only give us half our money back they just expected my 7 month old baby to sleep in a bed. STAY CLEAR OF THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Bottlebrush21
Reviews.Content: This stay was booked through lastminute.com. We were supposed to stay in the Hotel Carbigoe but for some reason, which was not explained, we were sent across the road to the Park Hotel. We only wanted a place to sleep for one night and the offer seemed good at 44.55GBP. The room was tiny, damp, mouldy and overnight the dingy little bathroom stated to smell. Eventually the smell woke us up and we left immediately at 07.00. I have stayed in hotels all over the US and Europe. This was bat far the worst hotel I have ever seen. There was no point in complaining because the staff spoke very little English and did not care. Do not book this hotel or it's sister hotel, the Hotel Carbigoe unless you wish to be miserable!

Reviews.Title: “Rotten, Putrid, Digusting, Dirty 'Hotel'”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters101
Reviews.Content: We had a late night out and last minute decided to stay in a hotel around the SW1 area. The first place we try is the Corbigoe Hotel, 101 Belgrave Road. They tell my partner it will £95 to stay the one night. After a 3 mintue haggle, we managed to get it down to £45. We weren't expecting much, just a place to lie our heads down for the night with the basic needs one expects in a country such as England. So, we were told to walk down to number 64 Belgrave road...which was indeed the Park Hotel. We were 'greeted' by a very rude Pakistani man who tried to say the agreed price was not £45 but higher and was playing games. As it was 3:00 am we were not in the mood for this, we just wanted to sleep...however, we insisted he calls his colleague at the Corbigoe Hotel. He reluctantly did so and then mumbles to us 'ok , but three pounds extra for paying by debit card'. 'Hmm' we thought, ok fine , whatever. So we get given our key to room 205 (right next door to reception) Once we entered that room, we could not believe our eyes. You could argue: well what do u expect if u pay £45 for a hotel in central London. But this is no exaggeration, this place was a flea pit, stinking, crumbling, health hazardous hell hole of a room. We actaully laughed in disbelief. Then we opened a scummy looking door to what the hotel refers to as the bathroom. Imagine you are in Delhi, find the most poverty-stricken neighbourhood you can find, then go into the dirtiest looking restaurant u can find then ask to use the 'bathroom''. I could safely say hand on my heart, the bathroom in Delhi would be cleaner and more efficient than this one in London, at the Park Hotel. I immediately pulled the bed sheets off as I expected them to also be filthy. This is the only aspect whichI was not horrified at. The bed linen was relatively clean and fresh smelling. After seeing the room how it was I expected the bed linen be soiled in something nasty to keep in theme with the rest of the room. Phew, we thought, maybe we could just survive it until check out at noon. As we got ready for bed, and took our socks off we suddenly felt that our feet were damp. The carpet in the room was sopping wet! I knelt down to see if it was cleaning solution but instead I got a whiff of a rancid stench. Yummy! The only place I felt relatively safe was in the bed, but with the worry that the light which was directly above our bed , which was hanging by a string and could potentially drop at any moment and kill us! After actually dismantling the light ourselves so we could rest, we prepared to sleep. At around 5 am we were woken to the sounds of doors banging and people leaving and various other peculiar sounds. This was not really a big deal to me. I am still in shock how a hotel of this atrocious standard can be allowed to take business as it really is not only below standard, it is seriously dangerous. We checked out a noon which was the agreed time and we were aggresively asked by the man at reception to pay £10 for checking out 'late' .Needless to say there was no way were were parting with more money. This place is not worth even 2 pence for a years stay. I said to the man how shocked I was that this hotel can exist how it is, not to mention putting their prices at £95 before negotation. He then shouted back at me that I should stay at the holiday inn if I wanted a shower that worked. Hmm, interesting. We have found the whole experience quite amusing, what else can u do? I am just writing this so that anyone thinking of using this hotel, my advice.... you would be better off buying a sleeping bag from millets and finding yourself a park bench. You'd have fresh air, it's free (minus the sleeping bag cost) and you'd be cleaner by not washing in this hotel, and even if you stay in the clothes you have been wearing for over a month, walked through a swamp, and rolled around in pigs pooh....You'd still be cleaner and have had a more pleasent experience than at this DUMP of a 'hotel' Dont stay at this dreadful place! It is disgusting!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, worse hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: CLADSWELL
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel for a 5 night stay, They moved me to another hotel (which i had no information about before my arrival) The hotel they moved me to was very unclean. Ash in all the draws, blocked shower and toliet. Wires hanging etc etc. I stayed one night and checked into a much better hotel. What i now find very funny is that when i complained about the room, their reply was that they have never had complaints before, The management should read the other coments on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: cactusjac
Reviews.Content: After arriving on friday night we were shown to a room which was cramped, broken television on floor, dirty etc, but as we were late we decided we only needed a bed for night and would not be there for most of the day! We went to sleep reluctantly and were woken in the night by water pouring down the walls and coming through the ceiling. my partner myself and our 2 children plus clothes and luggage were soaked, then fire alarm went off and we were told not to worry. Manager was extremely rude and told us we would have to pay HIM!!! TO BE MOVED ROOMS. This hotel is a death trap and somebody is going to be kiiled, staff didnt care and we left the hotel and had to find another hotel. We moved next door to the Sidney Hotel which was very pleasant which I would recommend. Please don't stay in this hotel enviromental health should shut this hell hole down

Reviews.Title: “Depressed by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_BE
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this Hotel to anyone! We were cramped up the 5th floor in a bunk bedroom which was more like a storage room. It was very very small and we couldn't even sit in the room or move. After complaining we got a larger room, which was nice in space, but not very clean. Towels were not refreshed and the bed poorly made. The bathroom seems to have served on an airplane! Too small to even move or go to the toilet properly. Breakfast was very simple, but there isn't enough room to sit for eveye guest at once, so at times people would bump into you. Also the dishes were not very clean and reservation papers / crates / junk / ... was all around the "breakfast room" (which was also the reception! Anyway, VERY small as you understand). The people at the hotel were sometimes nice, but most of the time I got the impression they didn't really care. In short : please do not go there ! spent you're hard earned money elsewhere ...

Reviews.Title: “This is not an hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmcmik
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I went to this hotel in 2005! I never saw such an ugly hotel with such rude people!!! I cannot even explain what we lived there! First we had to sleep in another hotel in the same street. We told the man in the second hotel that we had paid to seelp in the park hotel, so we went back to the Park Hotel and said that we wanted to stay in the hotel we paid for! The man finally accepted and gave us a VERY dirty room! I had never seen such a room of my entire life : the TV didn't work, the dust was everywhere, the furniture was broken, the bathroom was destroyed and dangerous for feet and the window was just in frot of the garbbages... We went to the frontdesk and complained. We didn't pay something like $250 to sleep in such a room! The man became very very rude and he told us that he didn't wants us to stay at his hotel, we could look for another hotel! It was 09:00 pm... before that we paid for the breakfast in cash, then we changed our mind, but he refused to pay us back. Of course he refused to pay our 2 nights off. We had to look for another hotel and we found an "expensive" nice hotel, we had no choice as we were expelled from the hotel just because we wanted to sleep in the hotel we paid for! We wrote the travel website we used to book the 2 nights and thanks to the pictures we had taken and the poor "reputation" of this hotel, this website accepted to pay the 2 night nights in the new hotel where we slept! If I were you, I wouldn't sleep in the Park Hotel. The people there just want to take YOUR money, they don't care about the tourists, they are liars and cheaters! It was the worst experience of my tourist life! It had to be a romantic getaway, but it began the worst way possible! Don't go there! NB : Sorry for my English.

Reviews.Title: “Still toleraby well”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in June 2006 (me, my 3 years old daughter and my boy). We had no problems. Rooms are truly small, but dependently, for what her needed. We needed the room just for sleep and bathroom that we wash up. We wandered around London since morning by evening. There is also station of undergroud (Victoria station) very nerby (with baby carriage is for 10 minutes walking - still this no).

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay In This Terrible Hotel/ No Service”
Reviews.Author: indoboy25
Reviews.Content: Hello, We stayed in June 2006 in this Horrible hotel. The rooms are very small, old, not clean, window dirty, you could not look outside. The hotel owners were rude, we got not service from them, they only wanted our money. When we checked out we kept our bags in the hotel for a couple of ours and we had to pay for 2 suitcases 5 pound, THIS IS NOT NORMAL. When we came back, the owner asked us for a gift! So rude! He had to give us money for staying in this HELL HOTEL. In prison you get better BREAKFAST! In the breakfast room were a lot of bugs, so nasty! I WILL NEVER STAY IN THIS HELL HOTEL AGAIN. IT IS A ONE STAR HOTEL, BET THEY NOT EVER DESERVE THE ONE STAR! DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “great for location, awful for staying in!”
Reviews.Author: lou245
Reviews.Content: Park Hotel is located in a great area, really near Victoria station, so its really easy to get around london BUT i have to warn that this hotel is possibly the most depressing hotel I have ever stayed in! To be fair, the people who ran it were lovely to us from start to finish but the rooms were awful. Me and my partner ended up popping to victoria station to use the toilets as the smell was awful coming from them! The bedlinen was clean and changed in the morning but there were dubious stains on the oversheets the walls as well as what looked like dog hair all over the floor! The plugs were dangerously wired with exposed wires and scorch marks etc...the window was also missing the handles so we couldnt shut it! not too good considering the noisy road below! We avoided breakfast as we couldnt really stomach it so i cant vouch for the food there. sounds snobby but we went expected a 3 star hotel and ended up in something more like a hostel. Was booked as a surprise birthday present and to be honest my partner who'd organised the trip was gutted! In defense of the hotel the staff were nothing but helpful, almost apologetic for the hotel itself and the beds were comfy and you are located so centrally its ideal if youre exhausted and simply need somewhere cheap to sleep but do not visit there if your staying any longer than one night as you will be sorely dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “holiday hotel hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cannot say one good thing about the park hotel, on our arival we were made to walk to another hotel in the rain, after an already long journey. The people were rude and didnt speak much English, The rooms were very unclean, there was even sick on one of the beds when we arived, and the staff seamed shocked when we asked them to change it. I found clumps of hair on the carpet and in the beds and the room smelt of cheep bleach. i would advise people to stay away from the park hotel as it was the very low point of my holiday. if people are wanting to stay in a cheap hotel in london i would say to them "look else were" the park hotel RUINED MY HOLIDAY!.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I understood when i booked the holiday that the hotel would not be one of the best. I was certainly right! Me and my friend went away for a weekend and we were quite dissapointed. bathroom was up to standards but extreemly small, the room seemed quite dirrty. the carpet needed a good clean. on the first morning of waking up, i realized that there was some sort of stainigde on the bottom of my quilt, and to be honest it didnt look pleasent. it looked like someone had either -- on the duvet or been sick on it. It certainly wasnt me!!! But on the bright side it was removed straight away after i had complained! The only good thing about the room was that it had a balcony. This was pleasent for smoking in the morning and watching the world go by. The street which we was on was very nice. Shame about the hotel though!!!!

Reviews.Title: “hotel from hell”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: where do i start we checked in at 2 30 and was very disappointed with the room we had booked a triple room and we could not move it was 1 single and then 2 singles pushed together when we sat on the beds they shook we looked underneath and it was frames of thin wood banged together with matresses on top there was no where to hang clothes and they had to stay in the case the sheets were clean but the top cover was dirty looking the en suite was disgusting the shower head was filthy and had tape round it the handle to put the shower on was broke and taped up the sink was dirty and both shower and sink had alot of lime scale on them we were very unhappy but as they has made us pay when we came in we had no choice but to stay we then went straight out my 14 yr old twins were very unhappy the best is yet to come my daughter left her new phone in the room when we got back it had gone no one new where it was and the staff were terrible all they kept saying is nothing like this has happened before and said no one had been in the room but we new they had because we left a cup on the window and it was gone and the window open then two days later we set a trap we put earrings down and took a photo suprise suprise when we got back they had gone as well but once again nobody new i asked the cleaner she didnt no and when you went to reception all they would do was grin at you our overall stay was disgusting and we will never go to this hotel again and if you want a good trip dont stay here oh and by the way the fone was switched on the day after we got home and eveytime i rang it they turned it off but just to let the person who stole my 14 yr olds fone and earrings we have had the sim card cancelled and the fone blacklisted my only thought is has any one else had any thing stolen from this hotel and by the way the picture that they have on the sites is not the park hotel and it looks nothing like that inside a very angry mum and we have photos that we will add soon

Reviews.Title: “All you need.”
Reviews.Author: FrederickAlexander
Reviews.Content: It all depends on your expectations. We were in London for one week, and all we needed was a bed to sleep in. Your not supposed to hang around at the hotel when you're in London. We went out in the city in the morning. the Victoria St. is nearby with all its tube-lines. And stayed out until the afternoon, took a shower and went out for the evening. We didn't have any problems with the hotel at all, and they were smiling at us in the reception.

Reviews.Title: “The Folks Living on the Embankment in Cardboard Boxes Get A Better Deal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was tiny and dirty. The bedlinen had stains on it. The windows were filthy and let in a draught. The laminate flooring didn't fit the room and so there were many cracks in it at the edges. The radiator was cold but nevertheless made banging noises. Already I was regretting booking this awful place. The coffee facilities did not include sugar and when I asked for some was told 'five minutes'. However, two hours later it hadn't arrived. Whether it would ever have come or not I do not know. The final straw was when I went to the loo (which was in a room with a shower and was in total no larger than a coach toilet) and after doing the necessary, could not locate any loo paper. In addition, there was only one towel - a small hand towel which would have made it tricky to dry oneself after a shower - assuming the shower worked of course, which based on the rest of the facilities was probably very doubtful. The sink was filthy and had red stains, the origin of which makes the mind boggle. No way was I prepared to stay in this place overnight, even though I had paid upfront for three nights - so I left.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 had booked 2 rooms via the internet. The room itself was reasonably clean considering it was a budget hotel. However, the bathroom was the tiniet one i've ever seen in my whole life. There was not enough room to even towel myself down after a shower. As our flight out of london was in the evening and we had to check out in the afternoon, we checked with the reception on whether we could keep our bags in a spare room till we left for the airport on our last day. The man at the reception was nice about it initially. The next day there however, he told us he'd have to levy a fee of 3 pounds per piece of luggage! we've stayed in numerous hotels round hte world, and this was the first itme ever a hotel asked for luggage storage fee! When we disagreed, he got really nasty. Needless to say, we checked out of the hotel and stored our luggage in left luggage at the airport. Terrible service. Downright nasty people. Do NOT stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Park Hotel over Christmas and were pleased with the room and both the price and the location were great. Really great value too! We booked our room on the internet and it was exactly what we had expected, a budget hotel. We travelled with our 16 and 10 year old children and were travelling on a tight budget. This was a nice inexpensive hotel and catered well to our family - the front desk reception was very helpful to us througout our stay. The rooms were comfortable and suited us perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “The worse hotel ever!!!! Please don't book here”
Reviews.Author: Solyluna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this terrible hotel 4 nights. When we arrived, they made us pay first, then said that they had lost the key to the room and sent us some other place. The next day they gave us an awfully cold room (no blankets) with bugs and extremely dirty (no cleaning of the bathroom, didn't change the bed sheets from the previews guests). The staff is very careless and just don't care at all about their customers needs. They say they have internet access, which is not true, and also that they are less than 5 minutes away from the Victoria Station when they are more than 20 minutes away by foot. Please think twice or even more before booking at this horrible place.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beware, prices may be low, but try something else! I made the reservations almost three months before through an internet site I´ve used several times before with good results. When we came to the Park Hotel we met a rather surly gentleman who didn´t seem especially interested in having us as his guests. After I´d registered he asked whether we would like breakfast, as, he said, this was not included in the price we´d already paid through the internet site. Unfortunately I had not printed all the information from the site, because there it said clearly that breakfast was included. Breakfast would be (after a while of thinking) five pounds a day for the two of us. As we didn´t att all like the look of the premises we saw behind the little reception area (looked like a tiny breakfast room, dark and dirty), we said no thanks. All of a sudden there was some problem with our room and he said he would have to send us down the road to another hotel. We didn´t object as we thought the alternative could hardly be worse than the Park Hotel. So we wound up att the Carbigoe Hotel att 101 Belgrave Road. There we met the only positive part of the whole experience: a rather nice gentleman in the reception. The room was tiny, the shower certainly had both hot and cold water, but the water came mainly out of the tubing as the showerhead was clogged. Two out of four lights in the room and bathroom worked. The bed did have clean sheets, but the rest of the room was dirty, wall-to-wall carpeting of dubious colour, drapes that were graying from dust, ingrown dirt in the bathroom; no one knows what hid under the bed, we certainly didn´t look and I´m quite sure nobody else has for years and years. In spite of it all (and thanks to the clean sheets!) we decided to stay the two nights we´d already paid for and not let the sorry state of the hotel destroy our visit to London, rather take it as a lesson for the future. But please, if you can avoid our mistake, search for another hotel, there are lots of them i London, not all clean, but hardly any in sorrier state than the Park-Carbigoe!

Reviews.Title: “Not so cold”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know how someone from Canada managed to be freezing cold in August in Britain. However, we do agree that the hotel could have been better. There were two of us booked into a double room, but they only gave us one towel. Not that we needed two, as my wife refused to use the bathroom anyway because it didn't look clean enough. No lift, narrow stairs with grooves worn in the middle of the steps - a definite safety hazard. Receptionist was polite and friendly. Not a terrible experience, but given the bathroom issue it was lucky we were only there for one night.

Reviews.Title: “The Park Hotel, Nightmare in London”
Reviews.Author: robbyo
Reviews.Content: We found our hotel which was nothing like the description on the Expedia site. It was, at that time, described as a cosy, family run Hotel. It was dingy and small and had no heat, We had booked a month early and Expedia had charged us the rent in advance otherwise we would have left and found some place else. They tried to give us a room in the basement we argued with them and then they tried to put us into a room on the first floor. That room was small with a double bed filling the space. The room had a narrow corridoe leading to a grimy window looking out to a light shaft. The corridor was being used to store, upended single beds, making it impossible to get to the window. We finally got a room on the third floor overlooking the grimy rooftops. Of course no lift. The room was dirty the window was so filthy that you could hardly look out of it. The blankets were so dirty we wouldn't sleep under them. The room was freezing cold. We went out for some supper and I told the receptionist that the radiator wasn't working and she assured me she would have someone fix it. When we returned to the room it was still icy cold and the radiator was like a fridge. I went back down to the reeception to encounter a new person who informed me that they can't get an electrician at night....the radiator is supposed to be steam. He offered to give me an extra blanket. We couldn't/wouldn't use the filthy one we already had. I noticed the reception area was toasty warm and saw that it was being warmed by a couple of electric heaters. I demanded one of the them and he agreed and actually carried it up to the room and plugged it in. We spent the night, fully clothed lying on top of the bed. The shower was so small and filthy we wouldn't use it and the toilet flushed only after repeated flushing. We certainly suggest that if anyone is considering this hotel...don't.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”

Reviews.Content: All the other reviews seem to be telling the truth, pay a bit extra and stay somewhere else .Oh and yes there are bed bugs.
